recommended.title: Fumadocs
recommended.description: Open source docs builder. Fumadocs built this site!

recommended.title: Sentry
recommended.description: They do like a million things related to monitoring

recommended.title: Ngrok
recommended.description: Exposes local environments to the internet. Useful for testing webhooks and other APIs.

recommended.title: Obsidian
recommended.description: Open source, private note-taking app. Notion, but without all the bloat.

recommended.title: Linear
recommended.description: The best project management tool I've used. `CMD + K` has been perfected here.

recommended.title: Wispr Flow
recommended.description: Voice to text, not like google voice to text that never gets anything right.

recommended.title: AI SDK
recommended.description: want to use ai? npm install @ai-sdk/vercel

recommended.title: shadcn
recommended.description: Literally every site nowaday uses this.

unused.title: Svix
unused.description: Webhooks as a service. Can be used to easily spin up endpoints to test webhooks.

unused.title: dotenvx
unused.description: Dotenv but you can also use it to share your `.env` with other people??

life.title: Affinity Designer
life.description: The best alternative to Photoshop. One time license fee with most of the features of Photoshop.

life.title: Ente Auth
life.description: Open source 2FA. Has support for both Web + Mobile.

life.title: Spark
life.description: Desktop email client. Use it to manage a lot of email accounts (like 8+).

life.title: Wanderlog
life.description: Travel journal. Best app hands down for travel planning.

life.title: Fit Notes
life.description: Workout tracker. I use it to track my workouts and progress. Been tracking every workout on this since August 2018.

life.title: Dashlane
life.description: Password manager. They have a great deal on a family plan that you can use with up to 10 people. Also includes a VPN on the premium plan.

life.title: Splitwise
life.description: Expense tracker for groups. Has a slightly weird round up feature that can be confusing at first, but otherwise a great way to track expenses with multiple poeple.

life.title: Lunchmoney
life.description: General personal finance tracker. Use it to track my overall portfolio and investments, been using it as long as I can remember.

life.title: Mihon
life.description: For all the `weebs` out there, this is to read all your manga on the go.
